keyword: how many calories in a gallon of whole milk
title: How Many Calories in a Gallon of Whole Milk?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a gallon of whole milk, with a full nutrition profile including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and tips for lower-fat alternatives.
h1: How Many Calories in a Gallon of Whole Milk?
assumptions: Standard whole milk (3.25% fat), fluid, pasteurized; US liquid gallon (3.785 L or 16 cups); no additives or fortification beyond basics.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact fat content, processing, and regional standards. Always check product labels for accurate values.

quick_answer.text: A gallon of whole milk provides about 2400 calories, 128 g protein, and 128 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a gallon of whole milk?
faqs.a: Approximately 2400 calories for one US gallon.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a gallon of whole milk?
Is whole milk high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, it contains around 80 g of saturated fat per gallon.

faqs.q: How do calories compare in low-fat milk?
faqs.a: 2% milk has about 1920 kcal per gallon, skim around 1440 kcal.

faqs.q: What about carbs and sugars in whole milk?
faqs.a: 192 g carbs, all from lactose sugars, with 0 g fiber per gallon.
